title: Are humans still evolving? An anthropologist breaks it down.
summary: We are indeed still evolving, though it can be hard to tell because it happens over generations and often involves things you can't see, such as what foods different people are able to digest.

title: How to Measure the Earth’s Radius With Legos
summary: With just a friend, a phone, and a few Lego bricks, you can accurately measure the size of our planet.

title: Science history: Astronomy graduate student Jocelyn Bell Burnell discovers a signal of 'little green men,' but her adviser gets the Nobel Prize — Nov. 28, 1967
summary: Astronomer Jocelyn Bell Burnell detected a strange signal from outer space that would lead to the discovery of the radio pulsar. The signal, once described as coming from "little green men," would earn her adviser the Nobel Prize in physics in 1974.

title: “بسيج” يحقق مع ذئب منفرد
summary: أسقطت معلومات استخباراتية دقيقة وفرتها المديرية العامة لمراقبة التراب الوطني، المعروفة اختصارا بـ “ديستي”، ذئبا منفردا يبلغ من العمر 26 سنة، كان في طور تنفيذ مخطط إرهابي وشيك وبالغ الخطورة يستهدف المساس الخطير بالنظام العام. وعلمت “الصباح” أن عناصر الاستخبارات المدنية رصدت الأنشطة المشبوهة للمتهم، …
body: أسقطت معلومات استخباراتية دقيقة وفرتها المديرية العامة لمراقبة التراب الوطني، المعروفة اختصارا بـ “ديستي”، ذئبا منفردا يبلغ من العمر 26 سنة، كان في طور تنفيذ مخطط إرهابي وشيك وبالغ الخطورة يستهدف المساس الخطير بالنظام العام. وعلمت “الصباح” أن عناصر الاستخبارات المدنية رصدت الأنشطة المشبوهة للمتهم، على مواقع أكمل القراءة » المقالة “بسيج” يحقق مع ذئب منفرد fمنشورة على جريدة الصباح .

title: How dangerous are interstellar objects like 3I/ATLAS?
summary: Interstellar objects like 3I/ATLAS are most likely to enter our solar system from two specific directions, a new study suggests. What does it mean for Earth?

title: 100,000 mph 'comet fragment' explodes in green fireball over Great Lakes, eerie videos show
summary: A fireball lit up the skies over the Great Lakes in the early hours of Sunday and was visible for hundreds of miles.

title: People in China lived alongside 'chicken-killing tigers' long before domestic cats arrived
summary: Leopard cats were living alongside people in ancient China for more than 3,500 years before domestic cats arrived from Europe via the Silk Road.

title: Can't decide between a telescope and binoculars? Read this before Black Friday
summary: We break down the key differences to help you make an informed choice before the sales hit, so you don't waste money on something you won't use.

title: Decades-long droughts doomed one of the world's oldest civilizations
summary: A series of lengthy droughts brought about the fall of the Indus Valley Civilization, a new study finds.

title: Archaeology Fragments Quiz: Can you work out what these mysterious artifacts are?
summary: Break out your best magnifying glass to solve these visual archaeology puzzles.

title: Large, bone-crushing dogs stalked 'Rhino Pompeii' after Yellowstone eruption 12 million years ago, ancient footprints reveal
summary: Researchers have found footprints of large, bone-crushing dogs in the 12 million-year-old Ashfall Fossil Beds in northeastern Nebraska, suggesting these large carnivores may have survived a cataclysmic Yellowstone eruption that covered parts of North America in ash.

title: Best Side-Sleeper Mattress 2025: Picked by a Sleep Science Coach
summary: We’ve tested hundreds of the top hybrid, memory foam, and cooling mattresses to find the best combination of support and pressure relief.

title: A fossilized foot found 15 years ago belonged to enigmatic human relative that lived alongside Lucy, scientists say
summary: Freshly unearthed jaw bones and teeth that were found close to a previously discovered foot suggest human relatives tried several ways of walking before honing in on one strategy.

title: Chinese particle detector tests 'portal to physics beyond the Standard Model' — with outstanding results
summary: Deep underground in southern China, there is a 20,000-ton tank of liquid that can detect neutrinos. Named JUNO, the detector's first results are in — and they're very promising.

title: Most modern dogs have wolf DNA from relatively recent interbreeding. Here's which breeds are the most and least 'wolfish.'
summary: About two-thirds of modern dog breeds carry some wolf ancestry introduced within the past few thousand years.

title: 'Like a sudden bomb': See photos from space of Ethiopian volcano erupting for first time in 12,000 years
summary: Hayli Gubbi, a shield volcano in northern Ethiopia, erupted for several hours on the morning of Sunday, Nov. 23 — the first eruption since the start of the Holocene.

title: Marooned no more! Stranded Chinese astronauts finally have a way home following launch of unmanned 'lifeboat'
summary: China has launched an unmanned "lifeboat" to the Tiangong space station, ending a month-long fiasco. The spacecraft will eventually ferry home the marooned Shenzhou-21 crew, who have been stuck without a return capsule for over a week.

title: Award-winning astrophotographer Josh Dury recommends this telescope for budding astronomers. The price has already dropped to its lowest price this year
summary: An ideal beginner telescope that our expert reviewed earlier this year and recommends for those new to astronomy is now over $100 cheaper ahead of Black Friday.

title: Sistema Ox Bel Ha: A vast hidden system that's the longest underwater cave in the world
summary: This incredible submerged cave network is the longest of its kind in the world and plays a vital role in the region.

title: 'Hot knives and brute force': King Tut's mummy was decapitated and dismembered after its historic discovery. Then, the researchers covered it up.
summary: Irreversible damage was done to the pharaoh’s body.

title: ماذا قال توم كروز عند تسلمة أول أوسكار في مسيرته الفنية؟
summary: أشاد النجم الأميركي توم كروز بتأثير السينما وقدرتها على تغيير حياة الناس، وذلك خلال تسلمه جائزة أوسكار فخرية في حفل نظمته أكاديمية فنون وعلوم الصور المتحركة في لوس أنجلوس، حيث احتفت هوليوود بمسيرته الممتدة لأكثر من 45 عاماً وبإسهاماته في صناعة السينما.
